means: 短促的敲打（声）( knock的名词复数 )
敲，击，打( knock的第三人称单数 )

sentence.Network_en: This design knocks everything else into a cocked hat.
sentence.Network_cn: 这一设计令其他作品相形见绌。

sentence.Network_en: Ignoring feelings of tiredness knocks our body clocks out of kilter.
sentence.Network_cn: 忽视疲劳感会打乱我们的生物钟。

sentence.Network_en: This kind of news knocks you back a bit, doesn't it?
sentence.Network_cn: 这种消息使你有点儿吃惊, 是 吗 ?

PerfectNetExp.abs: When adversity knocks on your door , how will you greet it ?, 当不幸敲响你的房门的时候 , 你将如何回应呢?

this effect not only knocks down strength of pumping rod but also rubs through oil tube wall , leading to the oil well unable to work and economic loss of the oil field .偏磨使抽油杆磨损，降低了抽油杆的强度，造成抽油杆断裂，磨穿油管壁，影响油井正常工作，给油田带来较大的经济损失。
and when he knocks you better能够消除敌人
This knocks the turtle down several feet ., 这一下子把海龟撞下去好几英尺.

entry.def: If you knock on something such as a door or window, you hit it, usually several times, to attract someone's attention.

example.ex: She went directly to Simon's apartment and knocked on the door...
example.tran: 她直奔西蒙的房间，敲了敲门。

example.ex: Knock at my window at eight o'clock and I'll be ready...
example.tran: 8点钟敲我的窗，我会准备好的。

entry.tran: 碰，撞；（尤指）碰倒，撞倒，敲动
entry.def: If you knock something, you touch or hit it roughly, especially so that it falls or moves.

example.ex: She accidentally knocked the tea tin off the shelf...
example.tran: 她不小心把架子上的茶叶罐碰了下来。

example.ex: The baby was knocked from his father's arms...
example.tran: 婴儿被从他父亲的怀中撞落。

entry.def: If someone knocks two rooms or buildings into one, or knocks them together, they make them form one room or building by removing a wall.

example.ex: They decided to knock the two rooms into one...
example.tran: 他们决定把两间屋子打通连成一间。

example.ex: The spacious kitchen was achieved by knocking together three small rooms.
example.tran: 这个宽敞的厨房是由3个小屋子打通连成的。

entry.tran: 把…撞击到（某个位置）；把…打成（某种状态）
entry.def: To knock someone into a particular position or condition means to hit them very hard so that they fall over or become unconscious.

example.ex: The third wave was so strong it knocked me backwards...
example.tran: 第3波浪太大了，把我打了回去。

example.ex: They were knocked to the ground and robbed of their wallets...
example.tran: 他们被打倒在地并被抢走了钱包。

entry.tran: 使失去（某种品质或特征）
entry.def: To knock a particular quality or characteristic out of someone means to make them lose it.

example.ex: The stories of his links with the actress had knocked the fun out of him...
example.tran: 有关他与那位女演员有关系的传闻使他很不开心。

example.ex: When they first joined for training many were starry eyed about just sailing around the world. We soon knocked that out of them...
example.tran: 在他们参加培训之初，很多人还只是对环球航行抱有天真的想法。我们很快便使他们消除了那种想法。

entry.def: If something knocks, it makes a repeated sharp banging noise.

example.ex: His old truck, knocking and smoking, pulled down the road and out of sight.
example.tran: 他那辆旧卡车一边冒着烟一边哐里哐啷地沿路向前驶去，直到驶出了视线。

entry.def: If you knock something or someone, you criticize them and say unpleasant things about them.

example.ex: I'm not knocking them: if they want to do it, it's up to them...
example.tran: 我不是批评他们：想不想做那件事取决于他们。

example.ex: Never knock charter flights; they are opening up the world for budget-conscious travellers.
example.tran: 绝不要挑剔包机航班；他们使精打细算的乘客能够去往世界各地。

entry.def: If someone receives a knock, they have an unpleasant experience which prevents them from achieving something or which causes them to change their attitudes or plans.

example.ex: What they said was a real knock to my self-confidence...
example.tran: 他们的话是对我自信心的一次重大打击。

example.ex: The art market has suffered some severe knocks during the past two years.
example.tran: 在过去的两年间，艺术品市场遭受了严重的打击。

entry.tran: （尤指以相貌）给…留下深刻印象，使…倾倒
entry.def: To knock them dead means to impress people a great deal, especially with your appearance.

example.ex: Glamorous make-up is best reserved for days when you want to go all out to knock  'em dead.
example.tran: 魅惑彩妆最好留到你竭力想把所有人都迷倒的时候。

entry.def: If you tell someone to knock it off, you are telling them to stop doing something that is annoying you.

example.ex: Will you just knock it off!

auth_sentence.content: Opportunity never knocks twice at any man's door.
auth_sentence.res_content: Opportunity never knocks twice at any man's door.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Opportunity never knocks twice at any man's door.

auth_sentence.content: Life knocks the sauciness out of us soon enough.
auth_sentence.res_content: Life knocks the sauciness out of us soon enough.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Life knocks the sauciness out of us soon enough.

auth_sentence.content: When the post knocks and the letter comes.
auth_sentence.res_content: When the post knocks and the letter comes.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: When the post knocks and the letter comes.
